Below you will find an extensive list of links to organisations that provide advice on a wide variety of health-related matters.

This Council is not responsible for the content of External Weblink sites.

External Links

Age Concern link to external website
Age Concern is the UK's largest organisation working with and for older people. They provide vital local services as well as influencing public opinion and government.

Alcoholics Anonymous link to external website
Alcoholics Anonymous was established in the 1930's in America and arrived in Britain 55 years ago. There are more than 3,500 AA meetings every week in England, Scotland and Wales.

Alzheimers Society link to external website
The Alzheimer's Society is the UK's leading care and research charity for people with any form of dementia and their carers.

BBC Health link to external website
Your Health, Interactive Area, Healthy Living, Medical Conditions, Relationships, News, Message Board and more.

Carbon Monoxide Kills website link to external website
Carbon Monoxide Advice.

Channel 4 Health link to external website
Health advice from Channel 4

Department of Health link to external website
Their aim is to improve the health and well-being of people in England. Here you will find the latest on the Department's work, as well as health and social care guidance, publications and policy.

Faculty of Public Health Medicine link to external website
of the Royal College of Surgeons

HARP link to external website
Health for asylum seekers and refugees portal

Health Advice for Travellers link to external website
Whether you are going off in search of sea and sun, travelling on business, or trekking through the wilds, this site is designed to help you enjoy a healthy journey - and to deal successfully with any medical emergencies which might arise.

Health Development Agency link to external website
The Health Development Agency (HDA) identifies the evidence of what works to improve people's health and reduce health inequalities.

MedicDirect link to external website
The only interactive website hosted by leading UK medical consultants providing comprehensive consumer health information online.

Mental Health - Supporting and Caring link to external website
BBC site - looks at the issues surrounding support, including how to build better relationships, how to deal with difficult situations, how to care for young people - and the importance of caring for carers.

National Chinese Healthy Living Centre link to external website
The Chinese National Healthy Living Centre aims to promote healthy living, and to provide access to health services, for the Chinese community in the UK. The Centre takes an holistic approach, tackling both the physical and psychological aspects of health.

National Electronic Library for Health link to external website
The National electronic Library for Health Programme is working with NHS Libraries to develop a digital library for NHS staff, patients and the public.

National Health Service - Making a Complaint link to external website
How to make a complaint to the NHS

NHS Dental Leaflet link to external website
This information is meant to answer some common questions about NHS dentistry and make it easier for you to make choices about your own health care.

NHS Direct On-Line link to external website
Your gateway to health info on the internet

PALS - Patients Advice and Liaison Service link to external website
A new services that puts the patient at the very heart of the NHS and aims to make the journey through the NHS as smooth as possible, making sure that the patient and their carers have access to 'on the spot' information and a way of resolving problems quickly.

The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman link to external website
The Parliamentary Ombudsman and the Health Service Ombudsman undertake independent investigations into complaints about government departments, a range of other public bodies, and the National Health Service.

UK Health Centre link to external website
The UK's leading internet health resources library
